data.title: Lake Effect Snow Warning Updated
data.meta_description:
Lake Effect Snow Warning issued January 16 at 3:50PM EST until January 16 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland OH

* WHAT...For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, heavy lake effect
snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches
bringing storm-totals to 4 to 8 inches in the most-persistent
snow. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. For the Wind Chill
Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low
as 15 degrees below zero.

* WHERE...Northern Erie County.

* WHEN...For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, until 7 PM EST this
evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM this evening
to noon EST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and poor visibility.
The hazardous conditions may impact this evening's commute. The
cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are
not taken.

If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all
travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit
www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic
conditions.
data.text:
Sent

Tue, Jan 16 @ 3:54pm

Description

Lake Effect Snow Warning issued January 16 at 3:50PM EST until January 16 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland OH

* WHAT...For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, heavy lake effect

snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches

bringing storm-totals to 4 to 8 inches in the most-persistent

* WHERE...Northern Erie County.

* WHEN...For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, until 7 PM EST this

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and poor visibility.

The hazardous conditions may impact this evening's commute. The

cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are

not taken.

If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania

This notification was posted by North East (Township). North East (Township) is solely responsible for this notification and unless specifically indicated, no other community or individual utilizing Savvy Citizen is sponsoring, responsible for, or endorsing this notification.
